curam.util.trace
Class InvocationDifferentiatorChain

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.trace.InvocationDifferentiatorChain

public class InvocationDifferentiatorChain
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a collection of invocation differentiators. Boundary code that deals with generic method invocations can use this class to provide quick access to a way of differentiating between invocations.

The following are examples of how this class can be used in the EJB layer:

  • Using a configuration file:
    •     /**
    This class applies an invocation differentiator for methods in the EJB layer.
    It uses an {@link InvocationDifferentiatorChain} configured via the invdiff.list
    file in this package.
    Projects that use generic method invocations can add to this file their
    implementation of a {@link InvocationDifferentiator}.
    *&#47
   
    public class EJBInvocationDifferentiator {
      private static final Logger log = Logger
   				.getLogger(EJBInvocationDifferentiator.class.getName());
   	
      private static InvocationDifferentiatorChain chain;
   	
      static {
   	   try {
          chain = new InvocationDifferentiatorChain(
                 EJBInvocationDifferentiator.class
                    .getResourceAsStream(&quot;invdiff.list&quot;));
        } catch (Exception e) {
          log.log(Level.SEVERE,
                  &quot;Failed to instantiate the invocation differentiator chain&quot;, e);
        }
      }
   	
     public static String applyDifferentiator(String method,
                                Object... parameters) {
       if (chain != null) {
         return chain.applyDifferentiator(method, parameters);
       }
       // fall back on default
       return method;
     }
    }
  • Using Guice to inject the list of invocation differentiators
    •  &#64Singleton
	public class EjbInvocationDifferentiator {
		private InvocationDifferentiatorChain chain;
		
		&#64Inject
		public EjbInvocationDifferentiator(Set<InvocationDifferentiator> diffs) {
			super();
			chain = new InvocationDifferentiatorChain(diffs);
		}
	
		public String applyDifferentiator(String invocationTarget,
				Object... parameters) {
			return chain.applyDifferentiator(invocationTarget, parameters);
		}
	}
    In the component's Guice module use the multibinder to add the implementation: 
     
  public class MyModule extends AbstractModule {

	protected void configure() {
		Multibinder<InvocationDifferentiator> uriBinder = Multibinder.newSetBinder(
				binder(), InvocationDifferentiator.class);
		uriBinder.addBinding().to(MyInvocationDifferentiator.class);
      ...
	}
 }

Constructor Summary
InvocationDifferentiatorChain(java.io.InputStream stream)
          Use this constructor to provide the list of invocation differentiators using an input stream.
InvocationDifferentiatorChain(java.util.Set<InvocationDifferentiator> diffs)
          This constructor allows the use of dependency injection frameworks to provide the list of invocation differentiators (for instance using the multibinder extension in Google Guice 2.0).
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String applyDifferentiator(java.lang.String invocationTarget, java.lang.Object... parameters)
          Calls all invocation differentiators in the chain and returns the unique signature for this invocation if a member in the chain provides a differentiator.

Constructor Detail

InvocationDifferentiatorChain

public InvocationDifferentiatorChain(java.io.InputStream stream)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                     java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Use this constructor to provide the list of invocation differentiators using an input stream.

Parameters:
stream - an input stream pointing to a properties file with ISO 8859-1 character encoding
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the input stream cannot be read
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if an invocation differentiator class cannot be found
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if an invocation differentiator instance fails to initialize
java.lang.InstantiationException - if an invocation differentiator instance fails to initialize

InvocationDifferentiatorChain

public InvocationDifferentiatorChain(java.util.Set<InvocationDifferentiator> diffs)
This constructor allows the use of dependency injection frameworks to provide the list of invocation differentiators (for instance using the multibinder extension in Google Guice 2.0).

Parameters:
diffs - the set of invocation differentiators that would form the chain
Method Detail

applyDifferentiator

public java.lang.String applyDifferentiator(java.lang.String invocationTarget,
                                            java.lang.Object... parameters)
Calls all invocation differentiators in the chain and returns the unique signature for this invocation if a member in the chain provides a differentiator. Otherwise it returns invocationTarget.
This method can be safely invoked in a multi-threaded environment.

Returns:
the differentiated invocation signature
